WRITING.TITLE: Help me get out of lvl 37+
WRITING.TEXT: In Hero league I just cannot get out of the lower rankings. I am not an amazing player by any stretch but I am usually the one trying to carry the team. So may people at this level play for themselves and not the team and the bitching becomes tiresome.
What time tomorrow is the expansion released in the UK?
I purchased my base game from www.cdkeys.com when C:S was first released and it was 13.75. I have used them and CJS-CDkeys before and both work. CDkeys is probably the quickest.
Amen brother.

I have only been playing for a few months and I haven't paid for any expansions or cards. 2 questions:
1) Is it possible to do well in Ranked without paying for cards/expansions etc?
2) Can anyone recommend (or link to) good decks for noobs who don't have money to spare (yet)?
Level 18 is the highest I have made it to in ranked. In Arena I usually go 1 - 3 or 2 - 3. Highest wins is a 4 streak.
Well we all may as well pack up and go home. This is outstanding.
I love and hate these kind of threads. They show me how beautiful this game can be and remind me how bad I am and how much my cities suck balls.
Nice one! These are exactly the kind of thing I was after.

WRITING.TITLE: The best parks for Office and Commercial areas.
WRITING.TEXT: I use some from the Workshop but I am yet to find any that really fit in with well with level 3 offices or level commercial. I am getting a bit bored of seeing the same parks in 40 places across my maps!
For me the low price of the base game justifies the price of the expansion. I will be buying on day one, anything that add's extra dimensions to an already fantastic base game gets my vote.

HYPE HYPE HYPE HYPE.
CO/Paradox take my god damn money.
Thanks will give it a try tomorrow!

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone got a good tutorial for getting multi-track/platform stations to work.
WRITING.TEXT: Also the easiest station to use would be helpful. I have Traffic++ if that helps. TIA

WRITING.TITLE: How to delete all mods and assets?
WRITING.TEXT: I recently reinstalled windows and C:S. When I logged back into Steam, all of the mods and asses I originally subscribed to all returned. As I have so many, is there any way to delete all mods and assets in one go? I know you can enable or disable all but I can only see the option of going through the Mod UI and deleting them all separately.
It is a no from me.

WRITING.TITLE: Same day same old creative block
WRITING.TEXT:
I just can't build good looking cities and it is annoying the hell out of me. I get to circa 80k cims and my city ends up looking completely grid-y no matter how much I try to plan it not to be. When I tyy to stay away from grids my traffic ends up a complete night mare.
I am going to start a whole new city with unlimited money/all unlocked and try and get all my infrastructure planned in advance.
Any help or tips to keep my city feeling "real" would be gladly appreciated.

WRITING.TITLE: Map Request - Manchester, UK.
WRITING.TEXT: If anyone would be so kind!
Thanks man it's appreciated.
Thanks mate. Any support is welcome.
Keep battling on mate :)
Thanks as well. Just know that what you guys are doing is really helping me and others. :)
Thanks I know I'm not well but I'm determined to get better. :)
Thanks for the support everyone. Just shows what a bloody fantastic community we have here.
You from Manchester? Guessing from the name. I live there to

It's taken me years to admit I have a problem but now I feel ready to tackle it. I know things won't always be rosey in the garden but I know things will progressively get better. Hardest thing was telling my friends and family who all see me as the strong one! But it's relief now everyone knows.
I'm also on an SSRI and go on to beta blockers for the anxiety next week. Waiting for therapist referral to come through and starting CBT soon as weLl

Where did I say I was hiding away? I use the game to help relax for a couple of hours a day. I am constantly pushing myself to do things I don't want to or feel anxious about, this helps to take the edge of.
Thanks to you all :)
Cheers mate :)
I am having similar anxiety issues and panic attacks. This game helps me to clear my mind and relax. Thank you CO from the bottom of my heart.

I've tinkered with my public transport and now up to nearly 15,500 from 93,000. I think I may have gone bus route crazy in some areas (small district loops to metro stops) but they seem to be working.
I should add I dont have "free public transport" policy turned on.

WRITING.TITLE: Out of your total population how many Cims use public transport?
WRITING.TEXT:
At the moment my first proper city (its working well, just ugly as sin - much like me!) has around 92,000 Cims, of that 92,000 around 13,400 use public transport. So roughly 1 in 6.9 Cims use my public transport system (including a few hundred tourists). I wondered if this is a good number or if others have got a higher number of Cims using theirs transport systems compared to overall population and any tips for getting more Cims to use it.
I use small "district" bus lines that go to either a transport hub which links in with metro and trains or just to metro stops. I have tried to keep my metro lines linear but think I may have too many stops. The only people who tend to take my trains are tourists weirdly.
Ahh I didn't realise that. Makes it a little more tricky but I suppose with unlimited money things should be easy to solve if I plan well enough at the start.

WRITING.TITLE: Tips for planning and building my first large city..
WRITING.TEXT:
Usually with city-builders I build and grow a city organically and plan as I go. After seeing some of the amazing cities posted on here I plan on having a go a building a properly "planned from the start" city using "unlock everything" and "unlimited money".
Has anyone got an tips for the best way to start? Should I lay out all my freeway interchanges and roads before zoning? Do people have a full plan of what they plan to build before they start?
Also does using edited assets disable achievements or this just for mods that change game mechanics?
I haven't got above 5k yet without my city crashing down. I am a pretty experienced "city builder" but struggling to get this game off the ground. Even though I am still loving this game!

I have similar problems. I am an experienced city builder but having big issues with the 2 road connections to start. I have tried merging them and keeping them separate but both have resulted in huge jams at the connection to the outside world.
How do you connect the 2 roads at the start? Just combine them into one? Keep them separate and have one as an "in" and "out"?

Thanks, I saw those post and they are helpful but it doesn't really help me decide how best to work with the initial 2 lanes. I will have a play round when I get back from work and see what I can come up with.

WRITING.TITLE: How best to connect to the 2 lanes at the start of the game?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]
This is what I was thinking, play it for the weekend (if I can get on a server, UK here) and if it really is pay to win get a refund before Monday.
Yeah I hadn't thought of it like that. It's hard to think straight with all the treads crying foul play from SOE.

WRITING.TITLE: So what's your honest opinion?
WRITING.TEXT:
Is this pay to win or what?
Like many others I've followed the development of this game for a long time, hoping it would be a zombie survival game that blew DayZ out of the water and confined games like WarZ to distant bad memories. But having read player reviews and viewed streams it seems SOE went against the original stand point and airdrops seem to be game breaking and reinforce the view this is pay to win.
As this EA I'm hoping SOE will tune it to make it more fair but before I dive it and buy it can I have some less hysteric opinions on H1Z1 and if it really is pay to win?
It's not about the game so much, more why I should pay for EA. Maybe I phrased it badly.

I know it will be far from polished, as I say I played DayZ sa for a fair bit. I just can't get my head round paying to make a game better for people who will play for free eventually. I was hoping for some kind of badge at least ;)

WRITING.TITLE: Convince me to buy EA and not wait for it to become F2P?!
WRITING.TEXT:
I played a fair bit of DayZ SA until I got bored with its limitations and have liked the look of H1Z1 since I first saw it announced. But I can't work out why it's worth paying for EA when eventually it will be free to everyone.
I know you get the enjoyment of helping to develop and drive the game forward but will those who pay get any advantages or bonuses when the game moves to full release and F2P.
I really want to get it but just can't see why I should pay when it's ultimately free in the future.
